Position: Data Scientist
Location: Burnaby, BC, Canada
General Fusion is transforming how the world is energized by developing the first commercially-viable fusion power plant. Fusion will deliver clean, safe and on-demand power at industrial scale, providing a powerful complement to renewables and a pathway to a zero-emission grid.
Combining new technologies, proven industrial processes, and advances in fundamental fusion science, General Fusion aims to be the first in the world to develop commercial fusion power. Key performance requirements have been demonstrated at the system level, setting the stage for building a pre-commercial fusion power prototype.
Position Overview:
We are looking for a Data Scientist who will support the analysis of large, irregular data sets generated from General Fusion’s plasma injector and compression experiments. The ideal candidate will have the ability to use a wide variety of data mining/data analysis methods to build and implement models, algorithms, and data visualizations. They should also have a working knowledge of DAQ hardware and digital signal processing techniques to improve quality of input digital data.
Key Responsibilities:
Working with General Fusion physicists and engineers, develop the algorithms and code used to analyze data and interpret results from fusion experiments.
Implement and apply Digital Signal Processing tools to improve the quality of digital data from Data Acquisition hardware.
Manage data storage and processing pipelines.
Develop standard analysis tools, graphs and other reports for a wide user group.
Relevant Skills and Experience:
Required:
Minimum 5 years of programming experience using standard programming languages (Python preferred, C, C++, Fortran also considered).
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, etc.) and databases to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques (regression, properties of distributions, statistical testing, Bayesian analysis methods, etc.) and experience with applications.
Experience with good software development practices: testing, issue tracking, version control, peer reviews.
Proven experience in analyzing time data from physical systems.
Able to work collaboratively with diverse teams.
Preferred:
Experience using MATLAB and Igor Pro for data analysis.
Background in physics, with an emphasis on plasma physics.
Background in electrical engineering or engineering physics.
Experience working with DAQ hardware.
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.

Job Summary

The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) Institute of Musculoskeletal Health and Arthritis (IMHA), headquartered at the University of British Columbia, is one of thirteen virtual institutes of CIHR. CIHR-IMHA's mandate is to support ethical and impactful research to enhance active living, mobility and oral health, and to address the wide range of conditions related to bones, joints, muscles, connective tissue, skin and teeth. Musculoskeletal health is critical for promoting the physical activity needed to maintain mobility, productivity and general health and well-being. Prevalent MSK disorders such as arthritis and osteoporosis can limit mobility and physical activity, creating a vicious cycle of inactivity, degeneration and loss of productivity. Similarly, poor oral health and skin conditions can affect overall health and well-being.

In cooperation with the Scientific Director (SD), Associate Scientific Director (ASD) and Institute staff, the Analyst, Projects and Initiatives will be responsible for supporting the respective initiative lead in the development and execution of work plans and deliverables. conducting literature reviews and environmental scans to develop summary reports in support of Institute initiatives

data collection, analysis and the evaluation of projects/initiatives in the development of project related materials

compiling tables, charts, graphs and summarized statistics for integration in research papers or reports
contributing to the strategic planning process of the Institute in setting direction and goals through analyzing data, statistics
coordination and outreach in the planning and execution of webinars with communities that fall within IMHA's areas of focus, including: promotion, coordination of speakers, agenda setting, as well as technical aspects with the WebEx program
coordination of Priority Planning Groups (PPGs) to help set strategic direction: process, membership, TORs, meeting coordination and evaluation of progress

The Network Operations Center (NOC) Analyst performs technical analysis of system performance issues, thresholds and outages as they occur across customer ICT environments networks. The NOC Analyst performs research to troubleshoot and resolve the issue or, depending upon complexity, escalates the issue to higher-level systems administrators and network engineers. The NOC Analyst is responsible for researching and documenting various mitigation strategies and must maintain current and thorough knowledge of customer technologies and their significance to customer operations.

This individual must be able to prioritize remediation of issues in a 24 x 7 environment with critical uptime requirements. The NOC analyst may also perform basic system administration tasks such as network/system troubleshooting, patching operating systems and applications, and executing various scripts to avoid service degradation.

Provide timely response to all incidents, outages and performance alerts. Categorize issues for escalation to appropriate technical teams.
Recognize, identify prioritize and own incidents in accordance with customer business requirements, organizational policies and operational impact.
Collect and review performance reports for various systems, and report trends in hardware and application performance to assist senior technical personnel to predict future issues or outages.
Monitor a wide variety of information and network systems that include, but are not limited to telecommunications circuits, LAN/WAN systems, routers, switches, firewalls, VoIP systems, servers, storage, backup, operating systems, cloud solutions and core applications.
Document all actions in accordance with standard company policies and procedures.
Notify customer and coordinate third-party service providers of issues, outages and remediation status.
Work with internal and external technical and service teams to create and/or update knowledge base articles.
Perform basic systems testing and operational tasks (installation of patches, network connectivity testing, script execution, etc.).
Support multiple technical teams in 24 x 7 environment operational environments with high uptime requirements. Varied shift schedules may include day or evening hours.
Manage the inventory of monitoring alerts to maintain current and relevant alerts.

Avidbots is bringing robots to everyday life to expand human potential. Its first product to deliver on this vision is Neo - a self-driving floor scrubber. Neo is widely deployed and trusted by the world’s leading facilities and building services companies in airports, shopping malls, hospitals, universities, and other commercial and industrial locations around the globe. Our robots use an advanced autonomy suite that we are constantly refining and expanding. The coverage and path planning team is responsible for all the pathing and behaviour execution processes on-board the robot, from the high-level task adoption to the low-level robot commands. As such, the planning software must be well-documented, instrumented, and reliable in order to ensure that our robots are executing in the most efficient and safe manner possible, while providing a solid foundation for future capabilities. To help us maintain this level of quality, the coverage and path planning team is looking for a quick-learning, quality-driven, and enthusiastic C++ Developer to join our team on a contract basis and help us deliver world-class software.

Implement fundamental design patterns and software development best practices in both new and existing algorithms.
Support development of advanced code health and behavioural metrics tracking, including code instrumentation, aggregation, upload, storage, and visualization
Write unit tests for all new functionalities and extend coverage of automated testing for existing code.
Work closely with our software developers during the design, documentation, and review of new features to ensure high quality results.
Improve maintainability and scalability of existing software through refactoring, profiling, linting, and generalizing features as necessary.
Collaborate with quality and software engineers to identify, debug, and address issues in the code.
Requirements:
Degree in computer science or equivalent, with particular emphasis on algorithm design and software development
Expertise in modern C++ development with 3+ years of industry experience
Experience with metrics data management, including standard tools, algorithms, storage/DB and transmission technology
Proficient with Linux operating systems and git-based version control
Strong understanding of design patterns, data structures and algorithms
Experience with software development life cycle
Familiarity with C++ unit testing frameworks and continuous integration tools
Bonus:
Experience with software metrics collection, aggregation, storage, and visualization (such as Prometheus, Netdata, AWS, Grafana or similar technologies)
Experience with robotics environments (including the Robot Operating System (ROS))
